{{disambig-more|Hobbit|[[The Hobbit (disambiguation)]]}}[[Image:Hobbit - Rockin' the Shire (cover).jpg|thumb|250px|The cover of [[Rockin' the Shire]] by ''Hobbit''.]]

'''Hobbit''' originating from Tyler, Texas is one of the oldest [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] themed bands who sprouted back to the 70's. They paved the way for the Fantasy Rock genre and have become forged in the definition of [[Middle-earth]] [[Music]]. 

Over the years, members of the band have been Paul "Turk" Henry (Bass/Vocals), Gene Fields (co-founder, guitarist, singer and songwriter), Keith Young (Drums), Richard Hill (Keyboard/L. Guitar), Andy Stevens, Tony Marsh and Tim Elliston.

Gene Fields passed away in 2019.

''Hobbit'' has also been featured in [[Amon Hen 194]] as well as ''[[Ringers: Lord of the Fans]]''.
